summary: This is a protective order issued by Judge Richard M. Berman in the criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein (19 Cr. 490). The order establishes strict rules for handling discovery materials to protect sensitive information, privacy of individuals, and the integrity of the ongoing investigation into uncharged individuals.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: Judge Richard M. Berman issues a protective order in the criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein to govern the handling of sensitive discovery materials.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The protective order is designed to protect sensitive discovery materials that could affect privacy, impede an ongoing investigation into uncharged individuals, and risk prejudicial pretrial publicity.
The order reveals the government has an ongoing investigation targeting 'uncharged individuals' related to the Epstein case.
Discovery materials contain 'personal identification information of specific individuals who are not parties to this action' and information that could identify witnesses.
Jeffrey Epstein is restricted from possessing discovery materials outside the presence of his defense counsel.
The order was agreed to by both the prosecution (Geoffrey S. Berman) and the defense (Martin Weinberg and Reid Weingarten).
